SUMMARY: BglJ is a positive DNA-binding transcriptional regulator of transport and utilization of aromatic Î²-glucosides arbutin and salicin. expression of gene bglJ induces bglGFB operon via unknown mechanisms. This suggests possibility that BglJ controls, directly or indirectly, expression of bgl operon. Currently, no experimental binding sites for this regulator have been reported in literature. BglJ is a protein that belongs to LuxR/UhpA family of transcriptional regulators. It shows a potential helix-turn-helix motif in carboxyl-terminal domain, which has 48% identity and 70% similarity to corresponding domain of RcsB protein.
